When we walked in they greet you at the door. They have a map of the tables so they know where you can be seated. They walked us to our table. When we finished eating, as we were about to leave they had great manners to  open the door for us as we left  Pizza was Very Satisfying

Pleasant atmosphere and great food, always cooked to perfection. I particularly love sitting at the bar especially when there's a good game on one of their TV's. Chicken Tequila with a nice glass of Pinot sitting next to my gorgeous BF... Priceless!

Excellent food and drinks ( Cocktails). After a hard day at shopping with wife. Well hard for me I loved the taste of food I got here. Staff is good only need to be a little bit more attentive if people are trying o get their attention to order. But even so this is a small thing and the place is worth it.

CPK is one of my favorite locations whenever there is one around. I got the jamaican jerk pizza with extra bacon on the thicker crust it use to come in. Pizza was delicious as usual.  Service was wonderful and the waiter was on it and very pleasant.  This is a great location and never disappoints!

Planned a pre-order menu at CPK for the boss and several co-workers.  Unfortunately, I called Chantara a couple of times because someone could not make up his mind what he wanted.  Instead of being annoyed (I would be) Chantara was professional, helpful and courteous.  As soon as we got to the restaurant, I noticed the utensils were placed on the table haphazardly.  I disregarded this because of the attentiveness of the staff.  The staff filled our water glasses, brought out bread and food like clockwork.  Everyone was satisfied.  Thank you to Chantara and the staff for making our boss' birthday an enjoyable experience.

CPK is one of those places that is kind of a last resort lol when I come here I usually get the same thing to be on the safe side because it's normally a hit and miss with the cpk menu. JERK PIZZA it's big enough to share with another person but the crust is thin so the pizza doesn't make you overwhelmingly full. The thin crust also allows the flavors to be a bit overpowering so I normally ask for easy sauce. 3 1/2 stars   BBQ CHICKEN SALAD big portion but for the price of $14 I don't thing it's worth it. Just iceberg lettuce chopped into little pieces with  corn, jicama, onions, beans, tomatoes topped with chicken. Ask for BBQ sauce and ranch on the side they tent to smother the salad in dressing. 3 stars  RED VELVET CAKE- probably one of better red velvet cakes I've ever had. It's not too sweet and the cake portion is always moist and perfect. Paired it with ice cream this last time and it was too much going on. I'll stick with just a slice of red velvet cake by itself. 4 1/2 stars  This location is big and roomy. Staff is average when it comes to service and attentiveness. Bathrooms are normally clean, but towards closing time can get a little Crazy up in there.  Probably be back if in the area.
This is why I frequent this particular location! Wow! Tina , I dont know how you do it! 10 stars!!!!

We love CPK especially their BBQ chicken salad with avocado. This time I was very disappointed. There was not enough lettuce. There was actually more cheese than the lettuce! I thought when I was mixing it that they made a mistake with my order but they did not! And the quantity is so small n I had to pay $18.99 for a small amount  of salad! We'll never come back to this one! No wonder there's not that much customers here!

I like coming here because I always know what to expect. Great food and great service. Our server today was Dominique and he was attentive, kind and timely. I ordered the lunch special of pizza and salad and it was enough to share. Then came the red velvet cake which was amazing. Their cocktails are good too. No complaints here!

Very clean , great food & Victor , the server was very much on top of everything .  He was informative , attentive ,friendly , & very proactive . He anticipated everything before I asked for it . Well Done! Ray Dinari

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, United States
review: great friendly staff,  great service, prompt and always delicious food. Couldn't ask for a better CPK.

I would give this negative stars if I could. We had the worst service ever!!!  After waiting 15 minutes after we ordered a beer, we went to the bar and got it ourselves. The server was no where to be found. The manager took our food order. Another server brought us our food. Waited and waited for our check. Finally asked another server to tell our waitress we needed our bill. She did and the server went the other way. The only time we saw our server was when we first sat down and she took our drink order and when she went to the table across from us to pick up her tip. We won't be going back to this restaurant.
Great place for dinner and an awesome time, family oriented and a professional staff. Our server mark was friendly and very helpful with our visit tonight

I had Horrible service today. From the moment we walked in from the hostess to the waiters ignored us and didn't offer us seating until we spoke up. The only time we spoke to the waiter was  when we called her to take our order and then the check. Never came to check up on us to see if we needed anything or if we were ok.  Food was good but makes you not wanna come back when customer service isn't good. I went during lunch and it wasn't busy so I'm not  exactly sure why we weren't given a better service.

Friendly staff had a cold pizza last week but today has a nice warm pizza and Daniel was a very nice server probably the best server I've had all year Thank you Daniel we will definitely come back to CPK. You remembered everything to make our dinner great.

The worst place ever when it comes to take-out. Your always waiting for your order that you placed over 45 minutes ago, the cashier is smart mouthed and talks to people disrespectfully when frustrated and question his customers on requests. If you want to dine-in you-ok definitely get your food on time because take-out comes last. For the future if you want take-out the Cerritos CPK will be a better option. At least they take pride in their customers. Unlike the Manager (Eric) at Lakewood CPK, he'll just tell you we're busy so wait an hour until I tell you the food you ordered is ready or when we ge

After leaving the CPK from Pine St in Down Town Long Beach because of the horrible service, we came here hoping the service wasn't the same. Our server Tina, came to my table with a smile, asked my family and I how our day was going and took our drink order right away.  We ordered our food and the manager happened to sit right next to us on her break. Her name was also Tina! She asked us if everything was okay and if we needed anything else she's right there to help us.  She seemed so cheery and super nice, so we somehow just ended up having a conversation with her and found out it was her birthday that day! We told her our experience at the other CPK and she apologized, even though she wasn't responsible for the management there.  I've never met someone so kindhearted like her.  I asked her why she was working on her birthday and she says she loves coming to work because her staffs are like her family. That was the sweetest thing!  Definitely coming back here to visit Tina!

I haven't been to a CPK in a long time. This location was pleasantly surprising, the atmosphere was nicer than most of the other locations I've been to and there are many options for the lunch special duo's.  I ended up getting my usual, the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad, which was just as good as it always is. The half order was too much for me to finish. My boyfriend got one of the lunch duo combinations with the Classic Crispy Chicken and the Sedona Tortilla Soup. They both looked great and he was really pleased with his food.  The only negative criticism I have is the lack of follow up after we received our food. We got our food in a very timely manner but no one checked on us for the remainder of our visit.

Took my parents here and they treated us very well. We only had 30 minutes to dine because of Doctor's appointment and they expedited our orders even though the place was super busy. The food came out fresh and really good.  Thank you Liz for your excellent service!

Great service from Dominique tonight!! He was very personable and treated my daughters like little ladies. He made my girls feel special! The food was good as always!! I would come back to this location just for the service :)

I love Cpk I come here almost all the time. Maybe 3x a week. Everyone is really cool & The food is delicious! Lupe is awesome!  You must try the chicken tequila extra spicy but with no jalapeños and angel hair. You will thank me later
Very fast service. As soon as we walked thru the door we were seated. Our waiter Saul was very nice, food was great...We will for sure be coming back to this location.

So I never ate here and was excited to try it out. We went in with a party of 8. The host told us it would be an hour wait. We said fine went back 30 minutes later and they said they called me 20 min after. Then they put us on another hour wait. and finally told us they don't have seating for a big party. so we left. VERY BAD SERVICE. Guess I will never try to eat there again

I usually don't write a review for chain restaurants, because the same foods is served at each restaurant. So when I do write a review, it has to be because of impeccable service or the opposite. Well my experience was the opposite.  My mother and I are seated, given menus and then order is taken. We knew what we wanted, so we ordered right away. (Lunch menu: 7" mushroom and spinach pizza and Mediterranean salad for $10.95) Now maybe you have to request for a basket of bread and oil, but we weren't offered any. And the fact that other tables were given bread and oil,  just kind of rubbed me the wrong way. Our food arrives, and we have no napkins. Our waitress never came to check on us. We only seen her when we ordered our food and when it was time to pay for our food. So customer service here was WACK! Don't get me wrong, the waitress was nice when we did see her, but she did a terrible job checking on us. And what really sealed the deal, given spoons 4 times and each time the spoon was dirty. So it's dessert time. I ordered the butter cake with ice cream. 5 stars just for this dessert. The butter cake is oh so good! Ok, now back to the dirty spoons. With our dessert, we are given a spoon. The spoon had dried up cheese, and the other spoon has dried up food particles on the handle. "Gross! I'm not putting my mouth on those spoons." So we ask for two more spoons. What do you know, both spoons are dirty. "Dang, do y'all wash these utensils? " Apparently not! At this point my ice cream is melting and I'm frustrated with these spoons. So this time, I tell the waitress to just give me some plastic spoons. Whew, finally can dig into my butter cake. I think I'm going to start bringing my own silverware or plastic ware to restaurants.

Had an amazing time! Miranda ( maybe Melissa, started with a M, brown hair big smile, sorry!) was so sweet! My mom and I came in mid afternoon and got some great lunch specials! With appetizers the rest we could save for dinner! She recommended a bottle of wine because we were droning the same thing and ended up getting two! Thank you so Mich again! Good luck to your chef going to the pizza finals! The hostess was so sweet and told us all about the competition your company holds for 25,000!!! Such an awesome inset I've and was to bring the company together! Good luck! Thanks cpk!

Came in placed a large to go order. Ordered all lunch specials. Everything was ok, except that the order was wrong because the young guy taking to go orders didn't understand us...which we didn't know until we checked the order before walking out. Two salads were wrong and he said that there was no size difference between the cup of soup and the bowl...just that they gave you bread for $2 more. We ordered one of each and that's wrong. The bowl is larger. Kinda common sense so he should know that and not misinform people. We ended up having one salad remade and took the other incorrect one because the wait was LONG. We waited about 30 minutes for 5 lunch specials (pizza and half salads). Eh, prefer LB location to this one.

6/14/15... I love CPK. My daughter and I was excited to have lunch together. We were greeted with a big smile from BreeAnn. She ask us to wait a minute for seating. There was another employee that walked up, never looked at us or acknowledge us . She ask the two ladies that walked in behind us to come with her so she could sit them. I told BreeAnn that was very rude. By my surprise I found out the her name is Linda and she is the General Manger.  Wow !!! I have never been treated like this before!

Today, my family decided to eat at CPK. Normally I have a good experience and the food is good so I said okay. The four of us walked in and the girl first tried to seat us in a cramped little booth and mind you my daughter has this big pregnant belly and I'm no skinny mini so why on earth would you put us in this child size booth? Not cool! She ends up taking us to a bigger booth. Cool. Then, this young dude comes over takes our drink order and comes back with drinks (my sangria that $10 wasn't even full, more like 3/4's full- really??) and then to take our food order. My daughter orders a BBQ chicken pizza with no onions. She even asked if it comes with onion and he said yes so she said no onions please. I order a salad with salmon and the men order their food. My daughters pizza arrives with onions and my salad no salmon. How can you mess up a simple order?? Were you even listening?? So, my hungry pregnant daughter has to wait for another pizza to be made and I have to wait for my fish. We also had to ask twice for pepper. We ended up paying over $100.00 with poor service. Next time I'll take my business elsewhere. There are plenty of places that really pay attention and provide excellent service. It just seems there are a lot of really young people working here and that's cool but they should really pay close attention and know how to attend to paying customers needs.

This review is ONLY for takeout... Got out of yoga at 9, starving knowing exactly what I wanted to eat: the amazing Mediterranean chicken. Called at 9:07 to get a to go order on my way home. Was told they don't take orders after 9. I was caught off guard and asked "really"? And got a "yeah, sorry, bye" and then click. Such a bummer because I thought about this meal all day and it was on my way home. Needless to say, I'll drive the extra bit to the marketplace or Los Al in the future. I was a hostess for a large chain restaurant and I never hung up on people. No Bueno.

The food is always great and the service is great as well. Avocado egg rolls and chipotle chicken pizza are my top two items. The egg rolls are definitely the best I've had compared to other restaurants. Saul is the best server! He really is the ideal server and knows what you need before you even ask.
What can I say? Full bar... family friendly. Consistently good food and great service. It's my go to place.

My cousin & I had the worst dining experience at this restaurant. She told me about her past experience of being completely overlooked and ignored by the Manager but no I HAD TO HAVE MY pizza and salad! It took so long for our food to come (seemed like the pizza was coming from Italy) then when or finally arrived it wasn't hot. I ate mine as it was but my cousin sent hers back only to not be satisfied. We tried to salvage the experience by indulging in dessert. We ordered the butter cake....15 minutes later I said let's cancel the cake and blow this joint! Should have gone to Round Table or Pizza Rev

My younger granddaughter likes the salads at California Pizza Kitchen.  She orders from the kid's menu when she is not that hungry.  She likes the kid's pizza.  My wife and I are big fans of the thin crust Sicilian pizza.  It is a little bit spicy, but very tasty.  On this visit, I tried the red flight of wine for $11.99.  It consists of three 3 oz. glasses of wine (pinot noir, merlot and cabernet sauvignon).  A good deal for the price. This is a family restaurant.  Very good service.  Plenty of parking in the mall parking lot in front of the restaurant.

As always service is great.  Was seated immediately.  Although this restaurant just went through a remodeling,  which I'm not empress by it, the food is what counts.  The food is always fresh and very delicious.  The new decor reminds me of "Norms".

I come here often and the service is always exceptional as well as the food. One of the most recent times I came, Lauren was my waitress. She was really attentive, nice and quick.   Ps This CPK is 100x's better than the Cerritos location that has such horrible staff.

Worst experience with this branch. Maybe it was the wrong day of the week to dine in here (Saturday night). I don't know. But the experience with that dinner was so bad.  I decided to eat here with the family cause I wanted to use the $10 discount I got from another branch, before it expires the next day.  Waiting to be seated was expected. We were told that wait time was 20-25 mins and we were seated even before that. I was actually impressed to be seated right away. The problem was.. The waiting for the orders to come out. We waited for an hour!! The server took a note of our drinks. Got there on time. Then she gave us a little more time to make up our minds for the meals. Then we got to place our order. So we were waiting waiting.. I appreciate that she's telling us that it'll be out in a few minutes cause orders are kind of backed up. But the fact than everyone else who were seated after us already got their orders. Was the thing that really pissed us off. Everybody was being served already. How come ours took an hour to be served?! Could've given us some complimentary bread at least. -.-" Not only that. I got my order and the pasta was under-cooked.. With a strand of hair! My mom's salmon was burnt! We were just so hungry to even complain. #3YC

The greeter (Friday/Lunch) was a little annoyed, I guess. I dont think she understood what I meant. Kept trying to give me another seat versus what I asked for. Thought I had a preference. WEIRD.... I eat her enough. Always order shrimp salad. Notice that the shrimps were over cooked this time, no flavor at all.. Portions are extra small...Maybe a new cook..Cooking too fast very noticeable...Hate to say  it always smell like "roach" spray. Carpet may need to be cleaned or replaced....SORRRYYYY!!!!!

Don't ever get the salads..waste of money..a "full salad" at $15 is barely for 1 person...and the hand tossed  pizza so thin hate to see what the thin crust pizza is....just hav to say thank god for gift cards otherwise will never get cpk again...what a waste of money or very nice gift cards!!!!

During the times that CPK has been around, hubby and I wasn't always impressed.  For the most part, it felt like over-priced pizzas compared to what I used to be able to make at home.  But, if one of our friends requested to go to a CPK, we would still go to at least see how the franchise is holding up. When hubby and I first went to CPK Lakewood years ago, we weren't really that impressed.  A little dirty on the inside, service was okay, food was okay, but the prices didn't make it really worth it.  Since then, we come to this particular CPK around once every 2 years, and we can say that they've definitely improved.  The restaurant is a lot cleaner, the service is a bit more on point, and the food is pretty good.  Still pricey, but not bad. The salads I've had have been fresh and tasty (the one with the candied pecans/walnuts is amazing).  Also had the chiles rellenos, which was VERY good.  Hubby has had the pizzas, which are always fresh, but isn't too memorable.  Hubby has also had their pastas, which he's liked. A note on the service: definitely not bad.  But, to the employees, if you will have a fake smile, please wait for the customer to turn away before you roll your eyes or drop your smile.  It doesn't make a pleasant dining experience to see you so unhappy to be there, or not wanting to deal with customers. Overall, it's a possible place we'll go to if we're in the area.  But it's not a restaurant that completely stands out to us, or has any catching feature that would compel us to come here versus another restaurant.

A good place for lunch.  Priced a bit on the high side but quality is there. FOOD The pizza here is pretty good.  I'm also a fan of the jambalaya. SERVICE: The service here is always pretty good.  For example, last time our host took note of which of us had leftovers and brought all of us boxes without us having to ask for them. PARKING: CPK is located at the Lakewood mall.  There is a large outdoor parking lot and parking is rarely an issue.

Ordered a To-Go order a couple of weeks ago and was super disappointed. I had to work the night shift and was barely able to get my order before closing. Basically I asked for chicken and shrimp with my pesto pasta but only got shrimp. When I tried to reach out, they had already closed and I couldn't leave a message. I called a couple of days later and tried to speak to a manager but was hung up on. Sad experience that makes me not want to go back to another CPK.
Excellent lunch special...personal pizza and Mediterranean salad (with pepperoni, mushroom, sausage, etc). Great service at the door, in kitchen, and free ice tea togo.

Had to do some shopping and I also wanted to use my free dessert for my birthday so I stopped in tonight.  I had a petite wedge salad, shaved mushroom and spinach Flatbread followed by the amazing butter cake with vanilla ice cream! I topped that off with a sprite. All of the food was amazing and the dessert is to die for!! My waiter Victor was super nice and helpful. They even sang happy birthday to me...loved it!! I will definitely be coming back! Thanks again!

We have had bad experiences at CPK before, but our visit to the Lakewood CPK really turned it around for us.  This CPK is OUTSTANDING!!! If you are fortunate enough to get Victor as a server you will enjoy your dining experience!!! The food is excellent.
Despite the horrible mall, this place is on the outside of the mall. Great Service. Good food. a bit pricey but well worth the meal. Desserts are good and drinks are tasty.

Came in to try a seasonal menu item and went with the roasted chicken and veggie meal which was cooked better than expected there was a little too much onion on the veggies but it didn't take away from how well prepared the chicken was ..a little pricey just under 20 bucks so not sure I wanna spend this much at a cpk for a dish in the future ...the wait was short and the waitress was quick and friendly and I appreciate her writing down no onions on my wife's tequila fettuccini Alfredo despite the dish having some when it was brought out.. I just started coming more often because of their sunny side and potato pizza ...amazing ..so def try that if you're around one of these chains
Danielle was GREAT! Such a doll. Asked me if I needed anything always at the right moment. I never went with an empty glass and left full and happy. She's a great asset to your team!

Ok. First let me say that the only reason I go to CPK  because my son is addicted to pizza. Having said that, last year I was frustrated with my CPK experience. However, today is definitely a new day. We just celebrated my sons 16th birthday at this local CPK. I had my usual (the sicilian - it's always right), and my son had his classic pepperoni.  The upside of this visit was our server, Lauren! Kudos to Lauren for being on top of her game. She gave us the best CPK experience I have EVER had at this location.  Not only did she check on us regularly, she made sure I liked what I had. She didn't go on break in the middle of our meal (leaving us hostage to someone who will never stop by). She kept coming back, and I felt for her because she's 6 months pregnant (the waddle was almost in effect). She was so professional,  courteous,  thoughtful,  and kind. Kudos again Lauren! Thanks for changing my opinion and my review.

Great Staff at this Place, Love to serve the guest and fresh food with  daily fresh Ingredients. Hope to see you all at this CPK, come on in and if you see this review I will buy you a small plate, ask for Tina.

Love the food and service, but unfortunately the new CPK APP is a great disappointment. You now have the option to pay on it, which I thought was cool, until my card got charged twice, for two different amounts. Now, I'm requesting my money back, which seems to be hard to do.

I haven't to been to CPK in awhile and I have to say the service and the food was great. I had the salmon and it cooked to perfection and the bartender was on point with my mascow mule. I will definitely go back to location.

Customer service is always awesome. I always order the fettuccine and my boyfriend orders the bbq chicken pizza. If you sign up for the cpk rewards you get a free appetizer the same day of your visit. You can ask for your waiter or waitress for free bread with butter while waiting for your meal to be serve. If your 21+ older you can do wine tasting.

So my brats and I were at the mall on a Friday night and I decided to treat them to an impromptu date w/mommy dinner before heading home. From previous experience I knew that CPK has a decent kids menu and if they didn't want that they could always go for pizza.  To my surprise the place has been totally renovated and it's very nice. I love the new seating and color skim. I'm not the only one because I've never seen this CPK this buzzing.  We were seated within 5 mins by a cheerful greeted and our server was almost instantly at our booth to take a drink order. I tried a apple berry sangria and it was strong and tasty. For appetizer we ordered my favorite...spring rolls (Baja and Thai), yummy as always! For the main course My two year old & baby girl shared the spiral Mac and cheese which was not that bad (for kids food), while my 8 year old and I decided to split a Cesar salad and a bar-b-que chicken pizza (added bacon). The salad was honestly nothing to write about, so I won't, but the pizza was good. The bonus to this experience, is that I am a member of CPK rewards program and I had $10 off discount in my account! Yay me!!! This made date night with the kiddos even sweeter!

Came in for a light dinner, was seated in about 10 minutes. The server was great, very cheerful and accommodating. I ordered the shrimp scampi pizza. The order came in approx. 10-15 mins, food tasted great!! Although I wished the portions would be a little bigger for the price I paid but hey they use quality ingredients so I guess that explains the price. Would recommend this place for those trying to eat healthy.
Came in almost close closing , Bad choice the staff was short and the food was less than marginal.
Great food every time....great service as well. Consistency is key to success Tina/Chatara and Company make it happen.
Never a dull moment. Excellent food, service, people, hostess, waiters, and atmosphere. Never a disappointment. The salads, pastas are the best.

I tried calling in my order ahead of time. I had two "coupons" or offers on my account -- one for ten dollars off, and another for a free birthday dessert. When I spoke to the woman on the phone, she assured me that I could use both. Since I had never used any before, I thought this was great, and I deferred to her statement, since she works for the company.  I pulled up to the designated parking area, and I called the number to say I was there. It took what seemed like forever to get someone to come out. When a person did arrive, the coupons were not on the statement. So, the girl went back in to check my account. Forever passed again. A guy came out this time, telling me that I could only use one of the coupons/offers. I said that I was told differently. He said he'd go in and ask his manager. At this point, so much time was being wasted that I just decided to walk in and take care of it at the counter. I didn't want to spend the next hour dealing with this walking back and forth from the car. Once inside, it took another twenty minutes. I was told that I was given the wrong information, and they took off the birthday cake. They printed me a new receipt and removed the dessert from my bag.  Now, I don't "need" a birthday cake, but I thought it was in very poor taste to take that off. Instead of wishing me a happy birthday and letting me keep the dessert for good will, the manager left a bad taste in my mouth, and I'll probably never come here again.  A trip that was supposed to take 20 minutes took over an hour. Yay. Happy birthday to me.

As stated by a good friend, the morning/ lunch staff is off the chain! The fella making the pizza's (Mario) is a expert in the art of pizza design, and the taste was phenomenal. Little Lina my server and bartender made incredible mojito's and margarita's and insured my food order was perfect and delivered in a timely manner. Lupe the manager even packaged my pizza to go after I couldn't finish it. There making the Sacramento Arden Square mall CPK look, well let's just say Sacramento is in the rear trying to catch up

I love CPK, tried the new blood orange sangria. Def yummy and a dangerous drink if ya know what I mean. Our server offered us the gift card promo and we were able to use it on our bill and save money on our next visit, win win!!

Stopped in here to use a CPK gift card  and was pleasantly  surprised  with great service and tasty meal! Great draft beer... we each had a pasta dish. Jambalaya  was terrific.  Spinach  & asparagus  spaghetti was terrific. Ordered a small pizza to go & chocolate  souffle no ice cream. Good souffle.  Had to remind server about the pizza to go. A very positive  experience.

I have been to CPK many times and it has never disappointed me. I'm not fan of most chains but CPK is just downright impressive. Sure, their prices are a bit excessive but the food is actually pretty darn good. I like CPK because they put many different kinds of ingredients on their pizza, hot and/or cold. It's quite innovative - I mean, who puts cold ingredients on a warm pizza and gets away with it? Thank goodness CPK does.  Okay, so everyone talks about the pizza...well, duh...its California PIZZA Kitchen. Now, what is really underrated are the PASTAS. I love pasta...and it's really hard to compare other pastas to CPK because, again, they combine ingredients that is just nothing short of excellent. Of course it's not traditional Italian pasta but I'm basing my review on the taste of the food, not authenticity. I highly recommend their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. It's great, get it.  Honestly, I've never had anything bad at this chain...from their quesadillas to their peach iced teas...its just simple, innovative and overall, a grand experience.
Food was very good but it is not worth the price. $70 for pizza, fettuccini, 2 half salads and ice tea. Ridiculously expensive!

I always have liked this restaurant. My favorites are as follows: 1. The Caesar Chicken Sandwich with salad 2. Artichoke dip 3. Bbq salad  I usually don't veer to far from these dishes. CPK is consistently good overall. The servers are very friendly and follow up without overdoing it. Parking here is pretty good and there is rarely a wait. Nice place for a lunch or dinner.

I have never been disappointed at this location! I work at a nearby hospital and often come here on a weekly basis, with coworkers once our shift is done. The fresh and delicious food really hits the spot after a long day!!  And, I have to be honest... it is so nice to receive such personal and attentive service, after caring for patients all day!! Often times, when I go out to eat - I am truly embarrassed to order - because I often have to make complicated changes to the dishes... I am never embarrassed here! The wait staff and management have gone above and beyond to meet my dietary needs and accommodate me. They are genuinely happy to make my experience perfect!  Everyone is wonderful. I am particularly fond of Vanessa. She has my order practically memorized and always greets my friends and I with a big smile!! It's the little things like keeping my water filled and bringing things/anticipating our needs. Thank you Vanessa and everyone else for making every visit so pleasant. There is also a young man with blonde hair who is very friendly as well, I cannot recall his name though!!

Came here for the first time after wanting to try it for so long. Service was friendly and the atmosphere was really nice. Ordered a pepperoni pizza for i think $13.99. It came with 6 slices. If you like thin crust pizza this place is for you but i prefer pan pizza. Going to a pizza restaurant, i kind of expected pan pizza or at least an option of pan or thin. But the pizza was still good, the pepporonis were huge and it was just the good amount of greasy. The pepper in the shakers they offered were really spicy, which i liked. The pizza was a perfect size for my boyfriend and i to finish.  Would i come back? Maybe to try their pastas. Although their iced tea was good. I think i'll stick with BJ's for pizza or even round table.
Again Eric slays it at cpk Lakewood. Food is great.    Service is great!!! Good job too Keylee!!

I love the food at this restaurant. Not too long ago they remodeled the place and my personal opinion, I  liked  it the way it looked before. My favorite dish is the bbq chicken salad! Service is good. Vanessa has been there since they opened the restaurant and she is very friendly, she is a waitress there. The dessert, I need to go for the key lime pie.

This place rocks! The servers are very attentive and on point. Food is delicious compared to other CPK locations and nearby restaurants.  I use CPK catering for my meetings and gatherings.  The food is consistent, fresh and tasty.  Kudos to management, kitchen associates and servers for a job well done!

Whenever I'm in the mood for pizza or a nice light lunch. I head for CPK. Love the menu and always looking forward to the newest items. Went for lunc this last Friday and tried the Chicken Milanese Salad, which was one of the new items on the menu and for dessert, the Butter Cake! OMG! the Butter Cake was the bomb!! The salad was really good as well, would highly recommend both! My sister and I shared both items and it was a good thing we did. We took two bites out of the cake and had to push it away. The cake was so rich and buttery, we thought we would gain 10 pounds if we ate the whole thing.

CPK is one of my childhood memory restaurants! I love this place I usually used to go to the one in Encino, but since I moved to LA area this one was the closest and I actually love it! Even when it's a busy night you don't have to wait too long. It's pretty spacious and the good thing about it, you have a mall next to it. Reminds me of the one in Northridge. Customer service here is pretty good hosts are very friendly and so are there waiters.

We always come here, the food is always great. Today, Tina helped us. She is the absolute best. We originally ordered it for take out but they were so accommodating and the weather was so nice we decided to stay. Tina provided outstanding customer service! Wow! What an asset to have. She is definately the ultimate team leader. Even though today is valentine's day she still went out of her way to help us.

The service was excellent. Considering it was Valentine's Day we have management checking on us constantly. This was my first time at this location. I would definitely come back if I'm on this side of town again.

Such a nice experience. We walked in around 820, and wasn't greeted right away, so we worried, but when we acknowledged we had no server, she appeared very quickly. Rose was fantastic. She was so sweet and bubbly and just amazing! She offered to take care of an appetizer or dessert for us, which was totally not necessary, but it was a very nice gesture. She was great with timing for beverage refills, bread, and food was delivered quickly.  She was seriously one of the best servers we have had anywhere! Rose- you are fab! Thanks for anticipating our needs and exceeding our expectations! You rock!

I went to have lunch here right when they opened, and was seated right away.  I noticed it was the host who explained the promotional items they were featuring once I was seated.  The server came within 3 minutes, and took my drink order.  By then I also knew what I wanted to have for lunch.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad, 1/2 order, which was $10.  If you want to add avocado, it's another $2.50, so I decided not to.   The server brought my drink right away, along with some bread and oil with herbs.  The bread had a crispy crust and soft interior.  I brought my computer, so I checked to see if there was free wi-fi.  There is free wi-fi at this CPK!  There's no password to punch in, and I was able to go on the internet simply by accepting the CPK wi-fi agreement. The BBQ Chicken Salad arrived, with about 1/8 cup of chicken on the top, and tomatoes bordering the rim of the plate.  It was very nicely presented.  It was delicious, too!  I think it could've used a little more chicken, but that's my only complaint.  I was shown the dessert options and chose to have the Tiramisu.  It was yummy!  If you like Tiramisu, I suggest you try theirs. All in all, it was a nice lunch.  More people started arriving to have lunch, and I noticed more servers were working as I left.  I recommend this CPK if you live by/are in the area of Lakewood.  Added bonus:  Shopping at the mall afterward (since you're already there...)

Good food, good service but very dirty, the middle part of the sitting area (see picture) Had a thick layer of dust that I could write my name  and also had sticky seats, I just hope that the rest of the restaurant is not being overlooked.

Oh CPK.  I normally love coming to you.  The bartender was amazing, salad felt thrown together, and Flatbread was great.  My huge disappointment.....Key Lime Pie.  I'm no baker or specialist in desserts, but I have had their pie many times.  I don't know who they are trying to fool, but they changed the recipe.  It used to be so smooth and fresh n' tangy.  Today it tasted like a mix, was grainy, and lacked that wonderful key lime flavor . Manager......fix your probs or you will be for sure losing some business.  You lost my love for your pie.....Won't be back for that!!!!!!!!.........so disappointed.....Couldn't even eat it
Food is always good, service is fast and nice. Thanks especially to our server today, Dianea. You rock! Happy New Year!

Curbside pickup.... Said it would be ready at 6:05 and still sitting here at 6:30. I have called and it's "just not ready". I won't be going to this location again. Terrible service. Should have offered a discount or a free drink... SOMETHING to show they care but instead it's attitude.

Came here on a Saturday for lunch.. Service was snail slow and horrible!! Had to wait 20 minutes for the drinks to get to the table, the promised bread and oil dip never arrived! Food got to the table after another 15 minutes minus the plates for the pizza.. I mean I've been here before but I guess there's a first time for everything, right? Food was good, so points for the chef! Hence the 2 stars...

My boyfriend and I came to this location and the food was great. The staff were very attentive and friendly. Our waiter recommended many different items for us to try. I haven't been here in a while and I was surprised at how small their menu became. If you're not feeling pizza, I recommend the original bbq chicken salad or their basil cream pesto pasta with chicken!
Never a bad meal here.  Always gourmet level.  My favorite place for unusual culinary treats.

always love the food here, been about 5 times and i love their lunch deals. perfect size and price, only disappointing part is thats the only time you can get their delicious sandwiches. can't do sandwiches any other part of the day. also, their GARLIC CREAM PASTA is delicious, but they skimped so hard on my chicken. It was 3 bucks to add it on, and I barely got any to warrant the $3 dollars, just like a few smallish pieces. definitely disappointing considering the price add on. The mushroom add on they didnt skimp on, so i recommend speaking up about lack of chicken or just get it with mushrooms.

My son was hungry so we went their . The waitress was nice and my son ordered a pizza which was good. I thought i had ordered a sandwich what i got was half a head of lettuce on my plate with dressing , some bacon , egg, tomatoe . Seriously it should not be put as a  Small meal this is a salad the head waiter passed by a couple of times and asked if everything was ok i did not say anything because of my son . That is when i felt this had to be a joke at least a cruel joke to be laughing behind my back. They were not going to ruing my date with my son who was  feeling bad with a migraine all day long. I will think twice of coming in here. After getting back with a cordinator of your establishment how can you even serve a  salad like this . Not pleased at all.

You can never go wrong with CPK. We got the italian chopped salad (full) and the margherita pizza and it was enough for the 3 of us. Always fresh ingredients and good quality. You can pick some "crazy dishes" like the moroccan salad (roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, red peppers, chopped egg and cranberries) or simple ones like the caesar salad or a pepperoni pizza.

They have gone back to fresh bread with olive oil, awesome. Service was wonderful our server was extremely nice drinks were refilled before they were empty and after questioning an ingredient in my dish they remade it immediately and it was much better. Paying was a bit of a hassle since she messed up the check, it took forever to get it corrected.

takeout for 2 pls... there's a first time for everything and this time happened to be my husband and i's first time and probably the last time we eat it. guess we're just picky people, didn't see why people enjoyed it so much, our regular pizza place tastes a lot better compared to the big name of CPK it just tasted like it lacked flavor, everyone seems to enjoy better dining in
I took my kids on the last day of school, food was great.  I like to see the great work environment with the employee at this location.

Wonderful Place to have Lunch and relax before shopping at the Lakewood mal or after shopping at the Lakewood mall. I love coming here for the spinach DIP! awesome the regular barbbque  pizza or nice ceasar salad! WAYYYY better than the Downtown LA location the service is so personal!

My experience today at this location was terrible. I placed a to go order and was told that my order would be ready at 5:58pm but when my husband arrived to pick it up, the order was no where close to being done. My husband was told that the order was still being worked on. At 6:38pm, my husband called me to tell me that he was still waiting on the order so this was now over an hour that our food was still not ready. I called the resturant to speak with the manager because they kept telling my husband they were working on it. I was connected with someone named Eric who said again that order was still being prepared and when I asked why it has taken over an hour for my order, he replied that he doesn't have an answer except that they are busy. He had an attitude with me because I wanted a better answer than what he gave. This is unacceptable and if this is how CPK treats their customers, than I no longer will be a customer of theirs.

Im sitting here having dinner for the very first time and i am with my wife and two month old daughter and she needed a diaper change and when i went to the restroom there was no changer flip down for me to change here on. We had to leave early due to this.

I have done curbside twice now and it has sucked both times.  The first had to go in and the second time I the curbside parking was full, but I called them to let them I was here and they told me to wait until a spot was available.  The food is good but service is horrible.
I love there Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza but what disappoints me is that the pizzas are smaller than before. Customer service is good they are very nice and helpful.

Had to send my salad back twice . They never ask if our food was ok and we had to ask for refills . The worst service ever . We sent food back and no manger came to us to even say sorry . Rude stuff and services.
Food is always good at any CPK but had to wait ten minutes in my booth before was ever approached by my waitress for a hello and get my drink order. If you're in a hurry sit at the bar.

Came here for lunch while shopping. Ordered the wedge salad, great portion for the small plate price, and ordered the small plate of Mac and cheese, which was came fried in four balls, so good! We shared the 5 cheese and tomato pizza which was also good, great friendly male host, and Nicole our server was sweet!

Shared the California fields salad and Garlic cream pasta with chicken with my mom. Just enough to share. It was so good! Oscar was a great host and very personal and out server Vanessa was outstanding! Such a sweet server!

CPK is my favorite restaurant. But this CPK is my favorite of all the CPK's around. These three people always treat my family and I to the best experience each and every time. Tina, Jose (Managers) and Lina (the best server ever). Tina and Jose always make sure that the food and service is the best. They come to our table to make sure everything is going smoothly. With Lina we never have to ask her for anything, it just seems like she reads our minds and brings us what we need. For example, refills drinks, napkins, etc. She always ask us after our first bite of our food if it is cooked the way we like it. Ever since she recommended the red velvet cake with ice cream to us we always order it. I definitely recommend getting it. The food and the service from Tina, Jose and Lina are the reasons we continue to come back here. We celebrate our birthdays here, other occasions and when we just feel like having a great meal. We feel like these three individuals treat us so good just like family. We always recommend this CPK to our friends and family. And lastly I just want to say thank you to Tina, Jose and Lina for being awesome.

This was my first time here and I will definitely be coming back. Our server Britney was amazing the Chinese salad was the best I've ever had.  The salad to other ingredients ratio was perfect the chicken was plentiful and absolutely perfect.  The prices were great fir the amount of food you got. Definitly a place I would recommend and come back too.
Food is always consistent and the service has always been good.  And the patio is dog friendly!
Lupe, I suppose is the store manager took my order because the bartender was no where to be found. Let's just say I'm happy good hand Lupe now off with my Jamaican jerk chicken pizza
This place is always reliably good, the parking next to the restaurant is usually ok, it does get busy being at the mall...but I've never had a hard time finding parking during lunch!

I have always been happy with the service at this CPK and I am a very understanding person: if I see that the server is busy with a lot of customers I understand and I tip well based on the effort (20%-25%). In this case we sat in an adjacent both to another couple and I witnessed the service that they received and I did not bring it to the manager's attention because I was very upset. My wife had to ask for our drinks to be refilled, while I observed our booth neighbors asked if they wanted a refill twice. I had to ask for bread the first time and a second time when we wanted more, when again I witnessed that our booth neighbors were asked if they wanted more bread. If the bread is not part of your service and I have to ask for it, then you should not offer it. Our booth neighbors had they dirty plates withdrawn soon after their meal, while my wife and I had to sit in our neglected booth with dirty dishes and empty glasses (for the second time) trying to have a conversation. We sat in our crap booth for over 20 minutes having a conversation with empty glasses and dirty plates. The only time the server was speedy was when he delivered the bill and he did make sure to revisit us to ask if we needed anything else. I guess that way when we informed him "No." he could not worry about us anymore. Why did the patrons next to us receive so much better service? We were not asked how our night was or how we were doing. What a crappy anniversary dinner. Never again will I come back to this CPK!!!

I don't know...I read a few of the reviews here and figured I'd chime in.  Everyone is gonna have a bad day at some level...but me and a few guys from work eat here pretty regularly and have really never had a bad experience.  Food is great.  Nice to be able to eat outside on the patio.  It seems like they've got a good thing going and are definitely worth a visit if you love this type of food (like we do).  Cheers!
Very good service, I love coming here. I just hate they got rid of the White Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing.

Close to work so we come here for lunch about once a month.  Usually it's a 4 or 5, food is good and service even better. Yesterday was a 2 star lunch.  Came for lunch  and our waitress was attentive only not to us, she even poured water in my sprite, took a long time to take our order and even longer to get the check.  Then our food was off.  The egg rolls were barely warm and the lunch pizza was garnished with something, IDK what but it looked like dried flowers crumbled on top.  Why ?

And 2 Stars just for our great Server she was awesome.(i believe Danielle) not sure. But No shrimp or potato soup? Shouldn't a restaurant like this know they don't have what they need and borrow or go buy some before they open!? Bad experience we asked for Kung Pao chicken since they didn't have shrimp and we literally received our pasta with 2 small pieces of chicken we told the manager as she was the one to run the food to our table that we had ordered it with chicken and she said "there's chicken in there" we then digged and found the 2pieces and told our server with pleasure she took it back and returned it with chicken. Not a possibility of returning.

My sister and I had dinner at this CPK a few days ago. I ordered the Asparagus Spinach Spaghettini and she had the Pesto Cream Penne w/chicken. Both of our dishes were dry, the pasta noodles were overcooked, and we had to load them down with Parmesan Cheese in order to get a little bit of flavor. Our server was great, but I don't know what was wrong with the food on this particular night.
Did not have a good experience today my hot food was not hot. Maybe the cook doesn't understand the importance of food safety.

I had a very wonderful experience. Our waitress was Dianea and she was very friendly. I absolutely loved her new red hair! Lol  I had a kids pizza with a petite salad and sangria. The meal was amazingly good and hot. The service was excellent with no complaints. I'll definitely be back!
Food is awesome and fresh. The atmosphere is very pleasant and welcoming. Diaena is excellent in executing exceptional customer service. I highly recommend this location.

Sitting at the bar area and you can have a full view of the people handing your food.  On several instances I watched the line cook put food in his mouth then proceed to handle food orders without washing his hands.  I've worked in the food industry for 8 years of my life and this is not acceptable.  This is how germs spread, diseases even.  Simple health code rule... Wash your hands! Food born illness and cross contamination are no joke!

I wasn't trilled about this place, however I gave it a chance. I tried their BBQ chicken pizza and let's just say that I won't want BBQ in a long long time. The service was good servers nice and friendly, the food however was not as great as I kind of hoped.

I came here with a friend the other night and the food was really good. The waitress was very patient and friendly. I ordered the four cheese ravioli with sautéed mushrooms and it tasted incredible. It was my first time trying ravioli and i want to eat it every day now. I would definitely come back for that dish. Thanks for the good service. :)

But I've never been disappointed.  Love the pizza we've tired most of them. Best salad the chicken Waldorf.  Only negative would be sometimes it's loud and noisy in there.

I love this place!! The food and the atmosphere is very good!! The staff is always nice and the manager was very personable and kind. He made sure that we were enjoying our food and service. Class act!! This is the only CPK location that I visit ever.
